text: Tao Te-san (born 24 August 1955), better known by his pen name Kuo Cheng, is a Taiwanese fiction writer. He is perhaps best known for writing the screenplays of several films directed by Ho Ping and Kevin Chu. His older brother Tao Te- chen (陶德辰) was a filmmaker-actor in the 1980s. Their family originated in Huanggang, Hubei, China. ==Works== {|class="wikitable" |- !Year!!Chinese title!!Translated English title!!Translator |- |1988||彈子王||"King of the Pool Players"The Chinese PEN, Summer 1991.||Ying-tsih Hwang |- |1991||狼行千里||"The Journey of the Wolf"Renditions, Spring 2002.||Susan Wilf |- |1991||上帝的骰子||"God's Dice"|| |} "The Journey of the Wolf" was one of the stories Kuo used when he and director Ho Ping wrote the screenplay for Ho's 1997 film Wolves Cry Under the Moon. ==Filmography== ===Films=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !Year !English title !Chinese title !Director !class="unsortable"|Notes |- |1985||One Bright Day||好個翹課天||rowspan=2|Fu Wei- te||original story (adapted by Wu Nien-jen) |- |1986||Gallery of Fools||哥們的糗事||original story (adapted by Yeh Yun-chiao and Chang Chien) |- |1993||colspan=2|18||Ho Ping|| |- |rowspan=2|1995||Heartbreak Island||去年冬天||Hsu Hsiao-ming||co-wrote with John S.C.
